_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Atlanta Terminal

Magellan Midstream Partners, LP

5 year Re-validation (10/31/18)



DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The Atlanta terminal is a refined products terminal  The facility is located in Atlanta GA and was purchased by Magellan Midstream Partners, LP in 2015.  The facility stores and distributes petroleum products such as gasoline and diesel.  In addition to petroleum storage, Magellan stores butane onsite for blending into gasoline which requires compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations since butane is stored at an amount greater than threshold quantity.



The previous RMP was completed by the previous owner; and although there have been no changes to the process, different company philosophies between the previous owner and Magellan resulted in different volume calculations for section 1.17 and the Worst and Alt Cases of this PHA re-validation.   



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RELEASE POLICIES

Magellan has a strong commitment to worker and public safety.  Resources have been and will continue to be invested in accident prevention including personnel training, procedure development, design standards and preventative maintenance.



If an emergency were to occur, the LEPC would be contacted and requested to respond to the emergency.  



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM

The regulated butane storage/blending process is compliant with the fourteen (14) elements of Process Safety Management.  The process controls listed in Section 7.4e include those utilized as the safeguards in the PHA.  There could potentially be other process controls used in the process.  The process does not have any trade secrets.  Inspections are conducted and documented to ensure the integrity of the regulated equipment.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The Atlanta Terminal has an excellent record of accident prevention.  There have been no accidental releases of butane from the butane process at the Atlanta

terminal that required reporting under the RMP rule within the past five (5) years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility is considered a non-responding facility.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

No changes have been completed on the process in the last five years.  Additionally, no changes are currently planned to the butane process.  As opportunities for improvement to the butane process arise, they will be evaluated by Magellan Midstream Partners, LP.
